alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 11:04AM EDT until July 11 at 8:40PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Vermont... Connecticut River AT North Walpole affecting Sullivan, Windsor, Windham and Cheshire Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Oxford and Cumberland Counties. Contoocook River At Henniker affecting Hillsborough and Merrimack Counties. Sugar River At West Claremont affecting Sullivan County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding of low-bottom fields and private roads in Conway and North Conway. Minor flooding in Transvale Acres, Moat Brook Bridge, and the lower part of E. Road flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
